block.p: Debra Lynn Denenberg, the daughter of Betty Denenberg and Dr. Allan Denenberg of Livingston, N.J., was married last evening to Kenneth Robert Marcus, a son of Ellen and David Marcus of Manhattan. Rabbi Abner Bergman officiated at the Water's Edge, a restaurant in Long Island City, Queens.

Debra Lynn Denenberg, the daughter of Betty Denenberg and Dr. Allan Denenberg of Livingston, N.J., was married last evening to Kenneth Robert Marcus, a son of Ellen and David Marcus of Manhattan. Rabbi Abner Bergman officiated at the Water's Edge, a restaurant in Long Island City, Queens.

The bride, 30, is a sales representative for the Computer Horizons Corporation, computer consultants in Manhattan. She graduated from Syracuse University. Her father is an internist in Denville, N.J.; the bride's mother manages his practice.

The bridegroom, also 30, is a vice president and the senior stock analyst at the Lancer Group, an investment firm in Manhattan. He graduated magna cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania, from which he also received an M.B.A. degree. His father is an assistant general counsel for Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, the stock brokerage firm in Manhattan, and a former vice chairman of the National Association of Securities Dealers in Washington. The bridegroom's mother is a former president of the Manhasset (N.Y.) Board of Education.
